revision.text:
{{Infobox military structure |name=Weeton Barracks |image=Singleton Road by Weeton Camp.jpg |caption = Entrance to Weeton Barracks |type = Barracks |map_type = United Kingdom Borough of Fylde |pushpin_map_caption = Location within the Borough of Fylde |location = [[Weeton with Preese]] |latitude =53.82009 |longitude = -2.93582 |ownership = [[Ministry of Defence (United Kingdom)|Ministry of Defence]] |operator = {{army|United Kingdom}} |built = 1916 |used=1916–present |architect = |built_for = [[War Office]] |garrison = |occupants =2nd Battalion the [[Duke of Lancaster's Regiment]] }} '''Weeton Barracks''' is a military installation at [[Weeton with Preese]] in [[Lancashire]], England.
==History== The barracks were established, using tented accommodation, as Weeton Camp in 1916 during the [[World War I|First World War]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/p02305dw|title=Weeton Camp, Lancashire: Blackpool Medics|publisher=BBC|accessdate=22 November 2014}}</ref>
The [[Royal Air Force]] also used Weeton Camp, along with [[RAF Squires Gate]] and the army camp at [[Kirkham, Lancashire|Kirkham]], for training purposes during the [[World War II|Second World War]] .<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.controltowers.co.uk/S/Squires_Gate.htm|title=RAF Squires Gate|publisher=ControlTowers.co.uk|accessdate=22 November 2014}}</ref> It continued to be used by the RAF, mainly for driver (MT) training, until 1965.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rafweb.org/Stations/Stations-W.htm#Weeton|title=Stations - W|publisher=rafweb.org|accessdate=27 December 2015}}</ref>
The barracks were significantly enhanced in the early 1960s and became the home of 1st Battalion the [[Lancashire Fusiliers]] in 1965.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://british-army-units1945on.co.uk/infantry/lancashire-fusiliers.html|title=Lancashire Fusiliers|publisher=British Army units 1945 on|accessdate=22 November 2014}}</ref> Since 2011 it has been the home of 2nd Battalion the [[Duke of Lancaster's Regiment]] after they returned from a three year tour in [[Cyprus]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lancashiretelegraph.co.uk/news/blackpool/9272401.2nd_battalion_Duke_of_Lancaster_regiment_takes_control_of_Weeton_Barracks/|title=2nd battalion Duke of Lancaster regiment takes control of Weeton Barracks|publisher=Lancashire Telegraph|date=26 September 2011|accessdate=22 November 2014}}</ref>
